featured.text: The heaviest drinkers in medieval Europe were actually Germans.
They have heavy and straight tree trunks.
The invention of the steam engine, which was used to power heavy machines, brought about a _____ change in society.
The weather bureau _____ that the typhoon would bring strong winds and heavy rains, and warned everyone of the possible danger.
The bridge collapsed under the weight of the heavy truck.

other.text: The heavy weight of iron materials.
He was late for the meeting the heavy rain.
All the flights to and from Kaohsiung were _____ because of the heavy thunderstorm.
For the five highway deaths, the author blames (A) a large heavy station wagon.

definition.zh_def: 重的，具有較大質量或重量的。
definition.en_def: Having a great weight; difficult to lift or move.
definition.example: The box was too heavy for me to carry.
